document.heading: Child Support and Welfare Reform Compliance Temporary Amendment Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-207, the “Child Support and Welfare Reform Compliance Temporary Amendment Act of 2000”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-825. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 19, 2000, and October 3, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 24, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-449 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-207 became effective on March 31, 2001.
